00011 // timer.cpp*
00012 #include "timer.h"
00013 // Timer Method Definitions
00014 Timer::Timer()
00015 {
00016 #if defined( IRIX ) || defined( IRIX64 )
00017         // IRIX Timer Initialization
00018         __psunsigned_t phys_addr, raddr;
00019         int poffmask = getpagesize() - 1;
00020         int counterSize = syssgi(SGI_CYCLECNTR_SIZE);
00021         
00022         phys_addr = syssgi(SGI_QUERY_CYCLECNTR, &(cycleval));
00023         if (phys_addr == ENODEV) {
00024                 Severe( "Sorry, this SGI doesn't support timers." );
00025         }
00026         
00027         raddr = phys_addr & ~poffmask;
00028         fd = open("/dev/mmem", O_RDONLY);
00029         
00030         if (counterSize == 64) {
00031                 iotimer_addr64 =
00032                         (volatile iotimer64_t *)mmap(0, poffmask, PROT_READ,
00033                         MAP_PRIVATE, fd, (off_t)raddr);
00034                 unmapLocation = (void *)iotimer_addr64;
00035                 unmapSize = poffmask;
00036                 iotimer_addr64 = (iotimer64_t *)((__psunsigned_t)iotimer_addr64 +
00037                                 (phys_addr & poffmask));
00038         }
00039         else if (counterSize == 32) {
00040                 iotimer_addr32 = (volatile iotimer32_t *)mmap(0, poffmask, PROT_READ,
00041                                 MAP_PRIVATE, fd,
00042                                 (off_t)raddr);
00043                 unmapLocation = (void *)iotimer_addr32;
00044                 unmapSize = poffmask;
00045                 iotimer_addr32 = (iotimer32_t *)((__psunsigned_t)iotimer_addr32 +
00046                                 (phys_addr & poffmask));
00047         }
00048         else {
00049                 Severe( "Fatal timer init error" );
00050         }
00051 #elif defined( WIN32 )
00052         // Windows Timer Initialization
00053         QueryPerformanceFrequency( &performance_frequency );
00054         one_over_frequency = 1.0/((double)performance_frequency.QuadPart);
00055 #endif
00056         time0 = elapsed = 0;
00057         running = 0;
00058 }
00059 
00060 
00061 double Timer::GetTime()
00062 {
00063 #if defined( IRIX ) || defined( IRIX64 )
00064         // IRIX GetTime
00065         if (iotimer_addr64) {
00066                 volatile iotimer64_t counter_value;
00067                 counter_value = *(iotimer_addr64);
00068                 return ((double) counter_value * .000000000001) * (double) cycleval;
00069         }
00070         else {
00071                 volatile iotimer32_t counter_value;
00072                 counter_value = *(iotimer_addr32);
00073                 return ((double) counter_value * .000000000001) * (double) cycleval;
00074         }
00075 #elif defined( WIN32 )
00076         // Windows GetTime
00077         QueryPerformanceCounter( &performance_counter );
00078         return (double) performance_counter.QuadPart * one_over_frequency;
00079 #else
00080         // UNIX GetTime
00081         gettimeofday( &timeofday, NULL );
00082         return timeofday.tv_sec + timeofday.tv_usec / 1000000.0;
00083 #endif
00084 }
00085 
00086 Timer::~Timer()
00087 {
00088 #if defined( IRIX ) || defined( IRIX64 )
00089         close( fd );
00090 #endif
00091 }
00092 
00093 void Timer::Start()
00094 {
00095         Assert( !running );
00096         running = 1;
00097         time0 = GetTime();
00098 }
00099 
00100 void Timer::Stop()
00101 {
00102         Assert( running );
00103         running = 0;
00104 
00105         elapsed += GetTime() - time0;
00106 }
00107 
00108 void Timer::Reset()
00109 {
00110     running = 0;
00111     elapsed = 0;
00112 }
00113 
00114 double Timer::Time()
00115 {
00116         if (running) {
00117                 Stop();
00118                 Start();
00119         }
00120         return elapsed;
00121 }
